website_summaries.verdict: The best budget battery load tester with a simple, straightforward control interface.
pros: Battery tester uses a single readout, making battery diagnostics quick and easy to complete
Comes with two settings for testing 6V and 12V batteries correctly
cons: Exterior casing of the load tester is made of flimsy plastic

customer_reviews.title: O yes, a must have for every shade tree mechanic.
customer_reviews.text: A nice tool to have on hand when you are doubting the strength of a battery. Schumacher doesn't lie! However, read the directions because I thought the components were burning the first time I used it. Do not panic, it will have a strong smell of overheating. That's NORMAL, it tells you right on the front of the tester!
customer_reviews.author: keith h.

customer_reviews.title: Took battery in to Advance Auto and they confirmed bad. Great tool to have around if you have ...
customer_reviews.text: Performed as stated. Tested first battery with voltmeter and tested ok. Used the BT100 and it showed it weak or shorted cell. Took battery in to Advance Auto and they confirmed bad. Great tool to have around if you have lots of marine & vehicle batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Clyde E. Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Battery Tester (Read the Manual)
customer_reviews.text: This product worked as advertised. WARNING! Read the manual! During first use it will produce some minor smoke which is NORMAL. Don't get worried about it like I did. This is the best bang for your buck! Now you can get the fancy digital battery testers, but this works great for all of my marine batteries and monitoring them for abnormal activities. Overall I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Low priced test for lead acid batteries works well
customer_reviews.text: Bought a returned item that was supposedly cosmetic damage for $14 and it turned out to be perfect cosmetically. Problem was the meter didn't work. I opened it up and the wire connection to the coil spring had a poor solder job, causing an open connection. I fixed it and it works perfectly now. Resistance of the load is 11.2 milliohms, just a bit less than the normal 12 milliohm target for 12V @ 100 amps. I'll probably wire in a jack to plug in a DMM to get high accuracy voltage measurements that aren't possible with an analog panel meter, so the state of charge can be more easily determined.
customer_reviews.author: Takei

customer_reviews.title: Perfection!
customer_reviews.text: This might be a bit early to write a review, as I have only used it once, but I felt compelled to share with the world the fact that the design and execution of this product ought to be a model for all other products in the world. There is no computer logic to flake out on you, it doesn't try and do everything or "do everything for you", it doesn't seem extra-proprietary... it is straight forward, and easy to use... it feels rugged, like it would survive commercial or even light-industry use... and it is literally the cheapest load tester on Amazon!?!? Unreal. Kudos to Schumacher for a *FANTASTIC* product.
customer_reviews.author: Osndok

customer_reviews.title: No quality control. dead on arrival
customer_reviews.text: Dead on arrival. Needle never moved under no load or load test. Does Schumacher have any quality control?
customer_reviews.author: G.

customer_reviews.title: Defective Unit - Just Missed Return Window
customer_reviews.text: I used the tester a few times then just recently noticed that negative battery clamp collapsed (not rigid on side connected to wire). Ordered on May 8 and shipped on May 9. Noticed the issue during evening of June 14. Just missed the return window by a matter of days. Now I will have to contact Schumacher company and ship tester to them at my expense. It's almost not worth the hassle of time and shipping expense however I will do it. Serious Quality Control problem for a product that failed at the battery clamp just beyond 30 days of infrequent use.
customer_reviews.author: Steve D.

customer_reviews.title: Value for the money! Works perfectly, accurate and is very simple to use!
customer_reviews.text: Nice tester. I had my hesitations based on cost, but really, this is exactly what you need to test a battery as if performs a REAL load test (glowing wire) versus a simulated load test (inaccurate and inconsistent) as the MORE expensive digital testers only seem to do these days. Literally took 5 minutes to unpack and be satisfied with the the results. Other testers (digital) simply haven’t measured up and I’d highly reccomend this product!!
customer_reviews.author: iamtheoneoff

customer_reviews.title: Charging system test does not work!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to test a charging system. I tried it on 3 different cars. 2 of the cars are known to have good charging systems. The 3rd was questionable and was the reason I bought the tester. However, the meter indicates that all of the charging systems are bad. Piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: James Kirkbride

customer_reviews.title: Helped me find two batteries out of my fleet with bad cells. Most were in dual battery installs where ...
customer_reviews.text: I have tons of tools and fancy battery checkers. I should have bought one of these 10 years ago. Helped me find two batteries out of my fleet with bad cells. Most were in dual battery installs where one battery would lose a cell and the slowly kill both batteries and also make the charging system work overtime. I used to just start a vehicle or put a heavily load on and then check with a volt meter. Rarely did that every show a bad cell. This will find one in 5 seconds when the battery goes form 12.6 to 10 volts instantly.
customer_reviews.author: One persons view

customer_reviews.title: A bargain
customer_reviews.text: Got tired of guessing if a battery is bad before I try to charge it. I did once in a while drive them to the auto store that tests for free but the local store closed recently. Because of the much longer drive I opted to get this. I tested 3 of my batteries and discovered one was shot, save me time, gas, and effort to charge the bad one. With having some solar power this gadget is a must and the price point was great. Now I need a good functional Hydrometer. It's a new age with power outages so solar is in and is worth the learning curve to get. Now all the battery bank gadgets are necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Bluecat

customer_reviews.title: Looks like good quality for the price;
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure that I am pleased with this product. I tested on a good battery to ensure quality and this thing started to smoke. Brought it to a mechanic and let him test it and he experienced the same. Guess this one has a defect or product is simply a cheap trick to make money on customers. Very disappointing but I do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: DH

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for monitoring battery life
customer_reviews.text: Very simple, solid construction with no unnecessary frills. It does it’s job well, and has all of the info you need to interpret results printed on the gauge itself. As many have indicated, it emits some smoke and an odor upon the first few uses, but so do toasters, so don’t freak out—it’s normal. If you’re interested in monitoring the life of your car, RV, or other “cranking” battery without taking it to the auto parts store for testing every year or so, this is well worth the expense. I’d definitely recommend this to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Great for testing 12V automotive batteries. This is a "dumb" battery tester, it puts an actual 100A load on the battery, so you can only test for a few seconds to avoid overheating the tester. "smart" testers are physically smaller, but they estimate the battery performance, and sometimes the estimate is wrong. So I prefer this simpler model.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Siegel

customer_reviews.title: Schumacher Battery tester review
customer_reviews.text: As an ASE Master Technician, I have used almost every type of tester on the market, ranging from this tester, to ones costing thousands of dollars. I'll have to say for the price 99% of the time, this tester is all you need to test your battery and/or charging system.
customer_reviews.author: allend43

customer_reviews.title: Works as it should, best for the DIY'er!
customer_reviews.text: I have used a couple different brands of these... This is a lower quality load tester but seems to function just as it should. Looking at build quality and parts used it is easy to see why it's inexpensive. Easily a great diy'er tester but probably not for the pros or a commercial setting. Either way I will still give it 4 stars because it functions as it should and I would not pass it up if your looking for a simple tester especially if your using it at home.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: 12 Volts battery test
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Done 2 test for my car's 12 volts battery. CCA and charging.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Well built and works well
customer_reviews.text: I really like this. I had a dead car battery, but my Battery Tender showed it as charged. I bought this to check. It showed that my battery was in fact bad. Then I bought a Noco Genius 10 and ran the desulfation cycle multiple times. Then I tested my battery again with this battery load tester and it showed that my battery is now good again. This is the only real way to test if a battery is good or not. It sure beats trying it out by driving and getting stranded on the road. Well done, Schumacher.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Schumacer Battery load tester
customer_reviews.text: I've tried it on a couple of 12 volt batteries and it worked just like it suppose to. I like the fact that it works good as it is advertised. There is a new digital battery tester available, but they are a lot more expensive. So since I only occasionally check a battery this one is just fine. I hope this summary is of some help to you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mid range quality & works as it should.
customer_reviews.text: This item works as it should. Not super high quality, but not super low quality. On par with the quality you would expect from a mid range item. It is made in China. The instructions says it will smoke on first few uses as it burns off chemicals. This did happen. The instructions also states that it will heat up if you test too many batteries in a row, I found this to be true. You can use this with the battery in or out of the car. You should have the car switched off and it is ideal to test with the battery disconnected, but not necessary.
customer_reviews.author: BH

customer_reviews.title: Works great, I wish I would have purchased one years ago.
customer_reviews.text: Great price, great tester. Easy to use, nice display, great for testing. I'm currently trying to desulfate two 12V lawn tractor batteries, both hold 12.9 volts, the tester indicated one produces 240 cold cranking amps, the other is still bad. Note: There is a heating element in the unit, this is what draws the current, thus it heats up and initially will smell and possibly smoke. Great unit.
customer_reviews.author: Andy from WI

customer_reviews.title: Cables TOO short.
customer_reviews.text: I would give the product five stars if it were not for the cables being too short. Even six additional inches would help. The length of the cables make it a little difficult to hook up and to find a place to set the tester. Otherwise I like the tester. The tester seems sturdily made. The directions are clear and useful. The dial is clear and readable. It runs a suite of tests that are very useful to me.
customer_reviews.author: ddh

customer_reviews.title: Nice product...better than my old one.
customer_reviews.text: My old load tester finally bit the dust and since we have 3 cars and a boat it made sense to have a way to test the batteries on my own, although I didn't use the old one that often. I like that this unit is smaller than the old one and you only have to attach the clamps then hold down the button for a few seconds to put a load on the batteries. Tried it out yesterday on a few batteries and it works great. It does get hot when testing load so be careful.
customer_reviews.author: CWK

customer_reviews.title: Instant failure: started smoking
customer_reviews.text: I should have been attentive to several other reviews. The unit began smoking as soon as it went into test mode. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: PeterP

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, great indicator on the display.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to test battery that dealer said was dead and couldn't be resurrected. Bought a Schumacher charger to go with it, charged the battery, put the load tester on it, Voila, full battery load capability. Great tool, easy to use, but be sure not to pull a load more than 10 seconds as indicated in the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Psyop

customer_reviews.title: A great buy on a very hand tool
customer_reviews.text: With this gem of a tool on a boat with five batteries I was able to quickly diagnose that I had one bad battery and a bad charger (one bad bank out of three on the charger). It saved me a lot of money in marina fees and looks to be a great tool to have around long term. I'd highly recommend this over the cheaper digital units. This thing should be bullet proof...
customer_reviews.author: J. Stee

customer_reviews.title: The clips can make a good connection if you set them carefully
customer_reviews.text: This is basically a voltmeter with a load resistor, but it works exactly as described. The clips can make a good connection if you set them carefully. While professional load testers can taylor the load to the CCA rating of the battery, this one is a flat 100 amp load. But that still gives you a useable indication of the battery's health at probably one tenth the cost of a variable load tester. As they say, it can smoke a bit, but hey it's dissipating over a kilowatt!
customer_reviews.author: David L.

customer_reviews.title: rattled
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the box there was something rattling around inside the unit. I took it apart and found 2 nuts inside. I put them back on where they should have been and tightened up the other 2 that hold the meter. I connected it to the batteries in my boat and it gave me a good reading. I now know the batteries are good and the onboard charger is bad.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use
customer_reviews.text: This product was easy to use and was purchased to test the battery in one of my vehicle. It was simple to use and read the meter to determine if it was time to replace the battery. Just clamp to the terminal on the battery and press the load button for less than 10 seconds and see the health of the battery. First initial use do cause a little smoke and a burnt smell but that was expected since it dd say in the directions to expect it. Very useful tool.
customer_reviews.author: Souk S

customer_reviews.title: Was a bit worried because of the low price.
customer_reviews.text: A family member had trouble with his car not starting at times. He took it to an auto parts store where they tested the battery. They said the battery was good. I tested it with this product and it clearly indicated the battery was very bad. He replaced the battery...problem solved. Good for the money. Not sure about the accuracy because I have nothing to compare it to but so far it has been right every time. Have only used it about 4 or 5 times, so I'm not sure how long it will last.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simple Reliable Battery Load Tester
customer_reviews.text: "Toaster" These have not changed much since they were first offered many years ago. There are expensive, electronic, "battery analyzers" available now, but the reviews are mixed on those, and load testers (like this model) are as simple and reliable as it gets. This model is not really made for the large Diesel engine starting batteries. Works well on most automobiles, (probably not a Tesla).
customer_reviews.author: Sabayon Linux User

customer_reviews.title: Works well so far
customer_reviews.text: I only used it once so far, on a good battery. It performed as expected, including some initial smoke which is normal. I'd prefer the leads to be a few inches longer, but they are ok. The wire insulation is stiff indicating cheap plastic or vinyl without silicone. These 2 things would be annoying if used regularly in a shop, but for intermittent use not much of an issue. It does the job. The starter draw scale is a nice addition.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Hoover

customer_reviews.title: I should have bought this 20 years ago
customer_reviews.text: I've got many more batteries to take care of now (than 20 years ago) and this diagnostic equipment will really help. I compared the voltage reading with a digital meter I use regularly and it was spot on. Being able to load a battery is one of those tests you really need to conduct. I already test specific gravity and this new tool just give me additional confidence that all my batteries are in peak condition.
customer_reviews.author: rtk11226

customer_reviews.title: Results same as store tester
customer_reviews.text: Result same as store non-load tester. Cons: 1) For DIY mechanics only because of safety issues; you have to know what you're doing. 2) display slightly hard to read (lettering vertical) and 800 900 1000 all close together. 3) Creates light heat/smoke. 4) Cannot be tested with clamps already on. Maybe best for battery stores.
customer_reviews.author: tom

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck in a battery load tester!
customer_reviews.text: For basic battery condition testing as a reasonable price, you can't beat the BT-100. Easily worth the price just to save the time running up and back to the parts store to have them load test your battery! A multimeter will test the voltage, but you can have perfect battery voltage (13+ volts) BUT the battery might not tolerate any load! Load testing is a must to check battery health.
customer_reviews.author: E. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Good basic tester - does what it is supposed to!
customer_reviews.text: Good basic tester. I bought it to better test batteries under load as a bad battery can still read a high voltage, yet not provide the power needed to start a mower, etc. If you want a lot of features, you may need to go to a digital unit. However, I like this one since it works for both 12V and 6V batteries, and does a good job for voltage testing under load.
customer_reviews.author: W. Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Voltage gauge defective right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Upon first use I noticed the voltage gauge didn't work--read zero volts when connected to a fully charged battery. Of course I didn't use it and notice this defect until well after the return period. $30+ wasted! March 2019 update: To the company's credit they sent a replacement unit no questions asked and it works. Rating changed to 4 stars for great customer service. Minus a star for quality control .
customer_reviews.author: homiec

customer_reviews.title: It's a Schumacher !
customer_reviews.text: Simple easiest way to determine the battery life. Have used it many times has served well. Schumacher quality decent for today's standards. The positive & negative alligator clips have a designated storage. Will put a load on the battery and beyond if one is not mindful. The needle scale for readings could be better. Plan to use for many years to come and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: EXPEDITION

customer_reviews.title: A Worthwhile Investment to Track Battery Performance
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this to load test battery capacity on my trolling motor batteries and car battery. It works very well and the instructions are good except for not telling you that a battery should be charged before performing a load test. It can also test the charging system in your automobile but I have not yet used it for that purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent

customer_reviews.title: fantastic
customer_reviews.text: How did I go this long and never own one of these? Those ponderances, is this battery any good? a regular volt meter can only identify the most catastrophically bad battery. this gizzie with 100 Amp load test tells the story when the battery is still reading ok on the volt meter but is functionally no longer good.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for the money!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been wanting to get one of these for a while and after a deal of research I found this is the best bang for your buck. I got it in and tested it out on several batteries everything works great! Great buy for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Must have for classic car owners!
customer_reviews.text: Happy I purchased this tester! After having my battery tested at O'Reilly's and being told it was good. I wasted time replacing battery cables only to have the same issue. I bought this and did a load test on that battery. It showed the battery as being bad. Brought it back to the part store and got a new battery under warranty. This is a must have if you have classic cars and I do!!
customer_reviews.author: Mike K

customer_reviews.title: If you have more than 3-4 batteries you need to work.
customer_reviews.text: I do not know why I fiddled with an acid squeeze bulb for all these years. With the new bat. charger from H-F that 'revives' an old battery, you can use this to tell — even tho' it is fully charged (one that sat dead for 5+yrs) — it is quick to puke out again. Four cars/trucks, tractor, and three mowers ...I needed this a long time ago. Jim
customer_reviews.author: JimCan

customer_reviews.title: No need to buy an expensive digital battery analyzer.
customer_reviews.text: This and a quality battery charger are all you really need. If a battery will take a charge and pass the load test, it's good. If one or the other fail, it's bad. It's really that simple for most applications. For most of us, there's no need to spend extra on a digital analyzer.
customer_reviews.author: Fortunate Son

customer_reviews.title: Simple and inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: Never wanted to spend money on one before, but some batteries cost over $150 these days. No point in buying a new battery when you don't have to. Yes, you can stop by and have a shop test 'em for free, but if you have kids and 4 cars in your driveway, it saves a lot of time for $20.
customer_reviews.author: Bookm_danno

customer_reviews.title: Perhaps I used it wrong.
customer_reviews.text: I’m sort of undecided on this. I load tested 2 batteries on my diesel and they checked out ok. However both were bulged so I replaced them. That fixed the starting system fault I was having on my pickup. I’d like one of those fancy ones that tell you instantly if the battery is bad but I have a hard time spending so much on a tool used so rarely.
customer_reviews.author: aronf_53

customer_reviews.title: Nice to have when you need it
customer_reviews.text: You can take your car battery to pretty much any place that sells automotive batteries and do a load test for free. For about $20 though you can have this load tester which makes it easy to test it at home and it is nice to have when you need it. Used it for the first time this morning when my car wouldn't start and was able to confirm if the battery was trash or not.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Garbage, don't waste your time...
customer_reviews.text: Tester worked for approx 2 months before just deciding to no longer turn on one day. When you call the manufacturer, they are rude and unhelpful; make you jump through a number of hoops to submit an RMA on their cheap Chinese junk. Just go with a reputable brand, it not worth saving a few dollars to have it break when you need it.
customer_reviews.author: That Guy

customer_reviews.title: should be good. It's a simple design
customer_reviews.text: I read all the reviews and took a chance. The voltmeter matched a calibrated Fluke meter. The load test appeared to work. I've only used it once or twice, so who knows. For occasional use, should be good. It's a simple design, but apparently effective.
customer_reviews.author: Buddy Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to diagnose a battery light I was on my dash. My original thought was I had a bad battery but with this tool I was able to find out that my alternator was going out. This tool helped me replace the right part and not waste money on un needed parts.
customer_reviews.author: Goodbrother79

customer_reviews.title: Amp reading off
customer_reviews.text: The volt meter is correct but the amp meter is off. It had a weak battery reading 700 amp but it was only 200. The 30 day return has long passe which is my fault for not checking it before I needed it
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Effective tool to diagnose battery condition.
customer_reviews.text: Great product from a top manufacturer of battery related items. Large color coded lines attach to positive and negaive battery posts. Shows battery condition during charging and stand still. Can do this with vehicle running or even solar battery bank with panels charging.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff T.

customer_reviews.title: Works well, sturdy, and accurate
customer_reviews.text: This has saved me from getting stuck, diagnosing battery problems in advance of failure. The ability to test during discharge is critical, as many battery failures stem from high internal resistance, which can't be measured other than during a discharge. Great tool.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Stoneburner

customer_reviews.title: Worked as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I had to buy this to troubleshoot my car battery. It died after 2 years with a 100 percent replacement up to 3 years but the guys at a major retailer said the problem was not my battery, that is was something else. After I bought this I went back to them and asked them to explain. They replaced the battery.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: It seems like I'm always chasing issue with my batteries and trying ...
customer_reviews.text: I own a boat with five batteries. It seems like I'm always chasing issue with my batteries and trying to determine which one as gone bad. This product makes it easy to put your battery under load and determine which one is causing the problems. Very easy to use - hook to the terminals, hit the switch and see if the battery is within its normal operating parameters. Super easy to use and priced great!
customer_reviews.author: Whitney Sauls

customer_reviews.title: This tester worked perfectly on my 1000 cranking amp battery ...
customer_reviews.text: This tester worked perfectly on my 1000 cranking amp battery and is decent quality. Another plus is it was $15 cheaper than at walmart. score! It smokes alittle on first use...don't worry..it's supposed to do that.
customer_reviews.author: badss213

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: What can I say, it is a glorified resistive heating coil with a meter on it. Does what it's made for, seems accurate.. but if you hold the button over ten seconds it glows red.. doubles as a very dim, inefficient flashlight if you literally have no other way of illuminating
customer_reviews.author: TW

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: It smokes a little on first use, but the instructions mention this up front. Must be burning something off of the resister at first. The meter works well and does get hot when testing battery under load. I'm satisfied that the meter works well and would recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: Karen G.

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: Having a Schumacher battery charger/starter that has served me well for several years, I was confident in this purchase. I put the load tester to work immediately this afternoon, with great accuracy. An essential tool that I had been missing. Thanks again.
customer_reviews.author: Matto

customer_reviews.title: If you have a diesel truck test each battery separately or you aren't getting an accurate reading
customer_reviews.text: Works great to determine if you have a good, bad or medium battery. One trick if you a diesel truck with 2 batteries and its slow to start you may have one good one and one bad one. You need to disconnect them and test them individually since even if you are clamping to the terminals the other battery is still sending electricity over since they are wired in parallel. Took me a no start on a cold day and some frustration to figure that one out.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Handy tool
customer_reviews.text: Was able to test the battery and alternator. Saved my from buying a new battery. Tested and then picked up new alternator and everything back in working order. Inexpensive and worthwhile tool to have around.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat it for the price
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Just stay within the recommended operating time window and everything should be okay. I would agree with previous comments about the cables being too stiff. It's just kind of what you expect for a bargain piece of gear. The rest of the construction is adequate for the task.
customer_reviews.author: John_E30

customer_reviews.title: Good diagnostic tool
customer_reviews.text: This device works as intended. I found out that several of the batteries in my vehicles, and motorcycles were getting towards the end of their lives. I'm glad I tested them and found out now as opposed to when I was in the middle of my trip or as winter approached.
customer_reviews.author: Wilkined

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive Necessity
customer_reviews.text: This good quality instrument is mandatory for testing batteries in a multiple battery application. This purchased was used to replace a loaned unit that never returned home and serves to test the individual batteries in an RV house and coach battery bank. Although all batteries in a multiple bank should be replaced as a set it's often not economical to do so. I use this load along with a Fluke 87 digital multimeter and current shunt to pair batteries with near identical loaded performance with good to excellent long term outcome.
customer_reviews.author: Kent Peyton

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Big time saver
customer_reviews.text: One of those tools that once you have it, you wonder why you didn't get it before. We have three vehicles plus a golf cart, and a lawnmower, so there's always some battery that's either going out or thinking about going out. With this load tester you can save time at the parts store, bypassing their tester and either buying a battery or knowing in advance that it's another issue entirely.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great tool from a very reputable company, very happy
customer_reviews.text: A good Tool to keep around the house to check if car batteries or almost any battery for motorcycle and car is still in the realm of being able to be used to run a vehicle or motorcycle. And it is very easy to read
customer_reviews.author: SB1989

customer_reviews.title: Good tool to have
customer_reviews.text: Great Product. It was a lot bigger than I expected but it works great. It is easy to use and understand. The cables are not too long, but I can usually get ti where is need it to. One word of advice though is that it kinda gives off a light smoke when it is first used, but there is no disturbance to the performance of the product. While I'm not a mechanic, its a great tool to help me diagnose my battery problems before going to see a mechanic.
customer_reviews.author: ABSTUBB

customer_reviews.title: Simple, accurate, reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: All I wanted was a simple to operate, accurate device to tell me the status of my batteries. It’s all that and at a great price! Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Nielsen

Right out of the box I was impressed with the durability and heavy duty design. I’ve already tested a bad battery and I tested my 3 year old battery in my truck. So far so good! Accurate and easy to read meter. I will be putting this thing to good use! And yes this does test your alternator and starter motor!

Just remember to hold the button for a few seconds- too long and you'll burn out the little heater inside.

customer_reviews.title: Simple and accurate!

customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Yeager

customer_reviews.title: INVEST  and  Save Time & MONEY
customer_reviews.text: The price of this piece of equipment is well worth it. I had NINE 12 V batteries showing 12+ V on a Multimeter, BUT I could not get 36V system to run. I must have spent (wasted) 3 or 4 days of backtracking & re-thinking. Arrived PROMPTLY. Easy to use. Checked them all out with this and found 3 bad batteries (12V 'surface charge' but IMMEDIATELY down to less than 8 V when engaged) sorted & used 3 good / qualified batteries and went on to next step of circuit fix. ALSO good for FYI car battery & starter check on a very cold day (worst case scenario). THEN you KNOW what you have.
customer_reviews.author: TJ in Lkpt IL

customer_reviews.title: Good Tester - Works as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: Used the BT-100 to load test 20 7.2v high capacity NiMH batteries. Works very well except some cool down was needed between tests as the unit was getting quite hot. The resistance element is a large nichrome wire, not a carbon pile as stated in some reviews. The nichrome wire is much more robust than a carbon resistor and also cools much quicker. I mounted a small computer 12vdc power supply cooling fan on top of the unit connected to the input wires to give about a 80% duty cycle. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Gary L

customer_reviews.title: INEXPENSIVE, ACCURATE TESTING DEVICE.
customer_reviews.text: Saved me time and money. Worked EXACTLY as described. Have a 6-battery system in my motor home. Fist battery I checked indicated bad under load. Took my Interstate AGM battery (which was 34 months old), back to Interstate Battery, and they gave me a brand new battery ($344.00 VALUE). Like I said, the tester saved me a lot of money!
customer_reviews.author: Sherry  Shuster

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: This unit is relatively compact, yet is able to perform a loaded battery test. Open-circuit voltage is OK and quick, and specific gravity test with hydrometer gives good indication of state of charge. This tester puts a load on the battery that indicates its ability to actually deliver, since internal impedance will rise near the end of life. A good item to have if you are wondering about whether a battery should be replaced. Easy to use and quite well made.

customer_reviews.title: A must have for anyone that owns any vehicle.
customer_reviews.text: I use this to check my cars and work trucks. Best money ever spent, because you can detect any issues with your battery or alternator before you break down. Do yourself a favor... get one and learn how to use it.

It can test load, battery condition, starter motor draw, and offers complete charging system diagnosis. Its shock-resistant meter is housed in a sturdy steel case that has a durable baked enamel finish. It also features a rubber insulated carry handle for your safety. The BT-100 comes equipped with super-grip battery clamps and a top-mounted rocker switch, making it very easy to use.
